intro: Pseudomertensia lahulensis, commonly known as Lahul Himalayan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Pseudomertensia lahulensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
